intro: Restio ornatus, commonly known as the ornate restia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to arid environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny white flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well-suited to coastal and inland regions. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
